daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.audio_split(path_to_audiofile, path_to_split_audio)[source]¶

Takes in an audiofile, split it as per the duration and returns the path to the split

Parameters:
  • path_to_audiofile(str) – The string is the path to the audio m4a file.
  • path_to_split_audio(str) – The path to save the audio segmented according to the duration.
Returns:

Path to audio segment for a given audio file.

daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.clean_string_list(x_list)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.clean_text_tokens(text)[source]¶

A custom preprocessor to tokenise and clean a text. Used in Content enrichment pipeline.

Process: * tokenise string using nltk word_tokenize() * Remove stopwords * Remove punctuations in words * Remove digits and whitespaces * Convert all words to lowercase * Remove words of length 1 * Remove nan or empty string

Parameters:text(str) – The string to be tokenised.
Returns:List of cleaned tokenised words.
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.cleantext(text)[source]¶

Custom function to clean enriched text

Parameters:text(str) – Enriched ytext from Ekstep Content.
Returns:Cleaned text.
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.convert_pdf_to_txt(path_to_pdf_file)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.custom_listPreProc(key_list, preproc, DELIMITTER)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.custom_tokenizer(path_to_text_file)[source]¶

Given a text file uses custom_tokenizer function to tokenise and write the tokenised words to a keywords.csv file.

Parameters:
  • path_to_text_file(str) – Location of text file to be tokenised
  • path_to_text_tokens_folder(str) – Location to write the tokenised words
Returns:

A dataframe with a KEYWORDS column that contains tokenised keywords.
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.df_feature_check(df, mandatory_fields)[source]¶

Check if columns are present in the dataframe.

Parameters:
  • df(dataframe) – DataFrame that needs to be checked
  • of strings) (mandatory_fields(list) – List of column names. eg: jpg, png, webm, mp4
Returns:

True if all columns are present and False if not all columns are present
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.dictionary_merge(dict_ls)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.downloadZipFile(url, directory)[source]¶

Multimedia Content are stored in cloud in ecar or zip format. This function downloads a zip file pointed by url location. The user is expected to have access to the file pointed by url. The extracted file is available in location specified by directory.

Parameters:url(str) – A valid url pointing to zipped Content location on cloud
Returns:Status of download. True: for successful download False: for unsuccesful download

daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.ekstep_ecar_unzip(download_location, copy_location)[source]¶

This function unzips an ecar file(ekstep file format) and parses all the subfolder. All the files are copied into one of 'assets','data','items' folder (same name as in downloaded folder is maintained) based on its location in the downloaded folder.

Parameters:
  • download_location(str) – A location in the disk where ekstep ecar resource file is downloaded
  • copy_location(str) – A disk location where the ecar is unwrapped

daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.findFiles(directory, substrings)[source]¶

Accio!! For a given directory, the function looks for any occurance of a particular file type mentioned by the substrings parameter.

Parameters:
  • directory(str) – The path to a folder
  • of strings) (substrings(list) – An array of extensions to be searched within the directory. eg: jpg, png, webm, mp4
Returns:

List of paths to the detected files

daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.jaccard_with_phrase(list1, list2)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.keyword_extraction_parallel(dir, timestr, content_to_text_path, taxonomy, extract_keywords, filter_criteria, path_to_corpus, path_to_category_lookup, update_corpus, filter_score_val, num_keywords)[source]¶

A custom function to parallelly extract keywords for all the Content texts in a folder. This is run typically after multimodal_text_enrichment. Part of Content enrichment pipeline. The funtion allows keyword extraction using TAGME or tokenising the words using nltk tokeniser. The extracted keywords can be filtered based on following criteria:

-taxonomy: if the word is a taxonomy keyword -dbpedia: if the keyword is domain keyword based on dbpedia criteria (occurs under the domain ontolgy in wikipedia) - none
Parameters:
  • dir(str) – Name of the folder containing enriched_text.txt file inside it.
  • content_to_text_path(str) – Path to directory containing multiple Content id folders.
  • taxonomy(str) – Path to taxonomy file(csv)
  • extract_keywords(str) – can be tagme or text_token
  • filter_criteria(str) – can be taxonomy or none
Returns:

Path to extracted keywords.
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.keyword_filter(tagme_response_df, path_to_corpus, path_to_category_lookup, subject, update_corpus, filter_score_val, num_keywords)[source]¶
daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.language_detection(text)[source]¶

This function will take in an enriched text as input and use google translate API to detect language of the text and returns it

Parameters:text(str) – The text for which the language need to be detected.
Returns:The detected language for the given text.

daggit.contrib.sunbird.operators.contentTaggingUtils.multimodal_text_enrichment(index, timestr, content_meta, content_type, content_to_text_path, GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS)[source]¶

A custom function to extract text from a given Content id in a Content meta dataframe extracted using Content V2 api

Parameters:
  • index(int) – row id for the Content
  • content_meta(dataframe) – A dataframe of Content metadata. Mandatory fields for content_meta are ['artifactUrl', 'content_type','downloadUrl', 'gradeLevel', 'identifier','keywords', 'language', 'subject']
  • content_type(str) – Can be youtube, pdf, ecml, unknown
  • content_to_text_path(str) – path to save the extracted text
Returns:

Path where text is saved

Replace punctuations from string, punctuation and space in a word with a DELIMITTER

Parameters:
  • word(str) – Typically a word whose punctuations and space are removed.
  • DELIMITTER(str) – String to replace punctuations.
Returns:

Processed string.
